title: ISC2 CISSP Practice Questions - Set 8 (Q351-400)
description: Final comprehensive CISSP certification exam practice questions - Complete collection!

questions.question: Commercial off-the-shelf (COTS) software presents which of the following additional security concerns?
options: Vendors take on the liability for COTS software vulnerabilities
In-house developed software is inherently less secure
COTS software is inherently less secure
Exploits for COTS software are well documented and publicly available
questions.explanation: COTS software is widely distributed, making vulnerabilities and exploits publicly known and documented, increasing the risk of exploitation by attackers who can study available exploit code.

questions.question: When conducting a third-party risk assessment of a new supplier, which of the following reports should be reviewed to confirm the operating effectiveness of the security, availability, confidentiality, and privacy trust principles?
questions.explanation: SOC 2 Type 2 reports assess the operating effectiveness of controls over security, availability, confidentiality, processing integrity, and privacy over a period of time.

questions.question: Which of the following would be the BEST mitigation practice for man-in-the-middle (MITM) Voice over Internet Protocol (VoIP) attacks?
questions.explanation: TLS provides encryption and authentication for VoIP signaling and media streams, protecting against MITM attacks by ensuring secure, authenticated communication channels.

questions.question: The Chief Information Security Officer (CISO) is concerned about business application availability. The organization was recently subject to a ransomware attack that resulted in the unavailability of applications and services for 10 working days that required paper-based running of all main business processes. There are now aggressive plans to enhance the Recovery Time Objective (RTO) and cater for more frequent data captures. Which of the following solutions should be implemented to fully comply to the new business requirements?
questions.explanation: Virtualization enables rapid recovery, frequent snapshots, and quick failover, significantly reducing RTO and enabling frequent data captures through VM snapshots.

questions.question: What is the MOST appropriate hierarchy of documents when implementing a security program?
questions.explanation: The proper hierarchy flows from organizational principles (high-level governance) to policies (what must be done) to standards (how to do it) to guidelines (recommendations).

questions.question: Which of the following is the MOST important consideration in selecting a security testing method based on different Radio-Frequency Identification (RFID) vulnerability types?
options: An understanding of the attack surface
Adaptability of testing tools to multiple technologies
The quality of results and usability of tools
The performance and resource utilization of tools
questions.explanation: Understanding the attack surface is fundamental to selecting appropriate testing methods, as it identifies all potential entry points and vulnerabilities specific to RFID implementations.

questions.question: An organization's internal audit team performed a security audit on the company's system and reported that the manufacturing application is rarely updated along with other issues categorized as minor. Six months later, an external audit team reviewed the same system with the same scope, but identified severe weaknesses in the manufacturing application's security controls. What is MOST likely to be the root cause of the internal audit team's failure in detecting these security issues?
questions.explanation: Inadequate test coverage means the internal audit didn't thoroughly examine all security controls and areas, missing critical vulnerabilities that the external team found.

questions.question: Which of the following is a limitation of the Bell-LaPadula model?
options: Segregation of duties (SoD) is difficult to implement as the 'no read-up' rule limits the ability of an object to access information with a higher classification
Mandatory access control (MAC) is enforced at all levels making discretionary access control (DAC) impossible to implement
It contains no provision or policy for changing data access control and works well only with access systems that are static in nature
It prioritizes integrity over confidentiality which can lead to inadvertent information disclosure
questions.explanation: Bell-LaPadula focuses on confidentiality in static environments and lacks mechanisms for dynamic access changes, making it unsuitable for systems requiring flexible access control.

questions.question: Which of the following vulnerability assessment activities BEST exemplifies the Examine method of assessment?
options: Asking the Information System Security Officer (ISSO) to describe the organization's patch management processes
Ensuring that system audit logs capture all relevant data fields required by the security controls baseline
Logging into a web server using the default administrator account and a default password
Performing Port Scans of selected network hosts to enumerate active services
questions.explanation: The Examine method involves reviewing documentation, configurations, and logs to verify compliance. Examining audit log configurations fits this assessment method.

questions.question: Which of the following BEST ensures the integrity of transactions to intended recipients?
questions.explanation: PKI provides digital signatures and certificates that ensure transaction integrity, authenticity, and non-repudiation to intended recipients through cryptographic verification.

questions.question: Recently, an unknown event has disrupted a single Layer-2 network that spans between two geographically diverse data centers. The network engineers have asked for assistance in identifying the root cause of the event. Which of the following is the MOST likely cause?
questions.explanation: A Layer-2 network spanning multiple data centers creates an excessively large broadcast domain, leading to broadcast storms and network instability.

questions.question: A company is moving from the V model to Agile development. How can the information security department BEST ensure that secure design principles are implemented in the new methodology?
options: Information security requirements are captured in mandatory user stories
All developers receive a mandatory targeted information security training
The information security department performs an information security assessment after each sprint
The non-financial information security requirements remain mandatory for the new model
questions.explanation: Incorporating security requirements as mandatory user stories integrates security into Agile workflows, ensuring security is addressed in each sprint from the beginning.

questions.question: Which of the (ISC)Â² Code of Ethics canons is MOST reflected when preserving the value of systems, applications, and entrusted information while avoiding conflicts of interest?
options: Provide diligent and competent service to principles
Act honorably, honestly, justly, responsibly, and legally
Protect society, the commonwealth, and the infrastructure
questions.explanation: Providing diligent and competent service to principals specifically addresses preserving the value of entrusted systems and information while avoiding conflicts of interest.

questions.question: Which of the following should exist in order to perform a security audit?
questions.explanation: A security audit requires an established framework or standard (ISO 27001, NIST, etc.) to audit against, providing criteria for assessment and measurement.

questions.question: When telephones in a city are connected by a single exchange, the caller can only connect with the switchboard operator. The operator then manually connects the call. This is an example of which type of network topology?
questions.explanation: Star topology has all nodes connected to a central point (the switchboard operator), which manages all connections between endpoints.

questions.question: A firm within the defense industry has been directed to comply with contractual requirements for encryption of a government client's Controlled Unclassified Information (CUI). What encryption strategy represents how to protect data at rest in the MOST efficient and cost-effective manner?
options: Perform logical separation of program information, using virtualized storage solutions with encryption management in the back-end disk systems
Perform logical separation of program information, using virtualized storage solutions with built-in encryption at the virtualization layer
Perform physical separation of program information and encrypt only information deemed critical by the defense client
Implement data at rest encryption across the entire storage area network (SAN)
questions.explanation: Virtualization layer encryption provides efficient, centralized encryption management while maintaining logical separation, balancing security with cost-effectiveness.

questions.question: Which audit type is MOST appropriate for evaluating the effectiveness of a security program?
questions.explanation: Security assessments evaluate the effectiveness of security programs by testing controls, reviewing policies, and measuring outcomes against objectives.

questions.question: Before allowing a web application into the production environment, the security practitioner performs multiple types of tests to confirm that the web application performs as expected. To test the username field, the security practitioner creates a test that enters more characters into the field than is allowed. Which of the following BEST describes the type of test performed?
questions.explanation: Misuse case testing examines how the application handles invalid, unexpected, or malicious input, testing boundary conditions and error handling.

questions.question: If the wide area network (WAN) is supporting converged applications like Voice over Internet Protocol (VoIP), which of the following becomes even MORE essential to the assurance of the network?
questions.explanation: Deterministic routing ensures predictable, consistent network paths for VoIP traffic, essential for maintaining quality of service and minimizing latency/jitter.

questions.question: Why would a system be structured to isolate different classes of information from one another and segregate them by user jurisdiction?
options: The organization is required to provide different services to various third-party organizations
The organization can avoid e-discovery processes in the event of litigation
The organization's infrastructure is clearly arranged and scope of responsibility is simplified
The organization can vary its system policies to comply with conflicting national laws
questions.explanation: Isolating information by jurisdiction allows organizations to apply different security policies and controls to comply with varying national laws and regulations.

questions.question: An organization implements Network Access Control (NAC) using Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers (IEEE) 802.1x and discovers the printers do not support the IEEE 802.1x standard. Which of the following is the BEST resolution?
options: Implement port security on the switch ports for the printers
Do nothing; IEEE 802.1x is irrelevant to printers
Install an IEEE 802.1x bridge for the printers
Implement a virtual local area network (VLAN) for the printers
questions.explanation: Placing non-802.1x devices in a separate VLAN provides network segmentation and allows appropriate security controls for these devices.

questions.question: Which of the following goals represents a modern shift in risk management according to National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST)?
options: Provide an improved mission accomplishment approach
Focus on operating environments that are changing, evolving, and full of emerging threats
Enable management to make well-informed risk-based decisions justifying security expenditure
Secure information technology (IT) systems that store, mass, or transmit organizational information
questions.explanation: Modern NIST risk management emphasizes adapting to dynamic, evolving threat environments rather than static, compliance-focused approaches.

questions.question: Which of the following security tools monitors devices and records the information in a central database for further analysis?
questions.explanation: EDR continuously monitors endpoint devices, records activity data in a central database, and provides advanced threat detection and investigation capabilities.

questions.question: In addition to life, protection of which of the following elements is MOST important when planning a data center site?
questions.explanation: After life safety, protecting data and the hardware that stores it is the primary concern in data center planning, as these are critical business assets.

questions.question: Which of the following documents specifies services from the client's viewpoint?
questions.explanation: Service Level Requirements (SLR) document what the client needs and expects from services, while SLAs document what the provider commits to deliver.

questions.question: Which of the following should be included in a good defense-in-depth strategy provided by object-oriented programming for software development?
questions.explanation: Encapsulation hides internal implementation details and data, providing a security boundary that prevents unauthorized access and modification of object internals.

questions.question: Which of the following is a key responsibility for a data steward assigned to manage an enterprise data lake?
options: Ensure proper business definition, value, and usage of data collected and stored within the enterprise data lake
Ensure adequate security controls applied to the enterprise data lake
Ensure proper and identifiable data owners for each data element stored within an enterprise data lake
Ensure that any data passing within remit is being used in accordance with the rules and regulations of the business
questions.explanation: Data stewards are responsible for ensuring data quality, proper definition, business value understanding, and appropriate usage of data assets.

questions.question: What is the FIRST step prior to executing a test of an organization's disaster recovery (DR) or business continuity plan (BCP)?
questions.explanation: Establishing clear evaluation criteria first ensures the test can be objectively assessed and provides measurable outcomes to determine plan effectiveness.

questions.question: A breach investigation found a website was exploited through an open source component. What is the FIRST step in the process that could have prevented this breach?
questions.explanation: Software inventory is the first step - you must know what open source components you're using before you can identify vulnerabilities or apply patches.

questions.question: What security principle addresses the issue of 'Security by Obscurity'?
questions.explanation: Open design principle states that security should not depend on secrecy of design or implementation, directly addressing the weakness of security by obscurity.

questions.question: What is the MOST important goal of conducting security assessments?
options: To align the security program with organizational risk appetite
To demonstrate proper function of security controls and processes to senior management
To prepare the organization for an external audit, particularly by a regulatory entity
To discover unmitigated security vulnerabilities, and propose paths for mitigating them
questions.explanation: The primary goal of security assessments is identifying unmitigated vulnerabilities and providing remediation recommendations to improve security posture.

questions.question: Which of the following virtual network configuration options is BEST to protect virtual machines (VM)?
questions.explanation: Traffic filtering controls what traffic can reach VMs, providing network-level protection by blocking unauthorized or malicious communications.

questions.question: Which of the following features is MOST effective in mitigating against theft of data on a corporate mobile device which has been stolen?
options: Mobile Device Management (MDM) with device wipe
Virtual private network (VPN) with traffic encryption
Whole device encryption with key escrow
questions.explanation: MDM with remote wipe capability can immediately erase all data from a stolen device, preventing unauthorized access to corporate information.

questions.question: An organization is implementing data encryption using symmetric ciphers and the Chief Information Officer (CIO) is concerned about the risk of using one key to protect all sensitive data. The security practitioner has been tasked with recommending a solution to address the CIO's concerns. Which of the following is the BEST approach to achieving the objective by encrypting all sensitive data?
options: Use a hierarchy of encryption keys
Use Hash Message Authentication Code (HMAC) keys
questions.explanation: A key hierarchy uses multiple keys at different levels (master keys, key encryption keys, data encryption keys), reducing risk by limiting exposure of any single key.

questions.question: Which of the following is a MUST for creating a new custom-built, cloud-native application designed to be horizontally scalable?
questions.explanation: IaaS provides the infrastructure resources needed for horizontal scaling, allowing applications to dynamically add/remove compute instances as demand changes.

questions.question: Which of the following access control mechanisms characterized subjects and objects using a set of encoded security-relevant properties?
questions.explanation: ABAC uses attributes (security-relevant properties) of subjects, objects, and environment to make dynamic access control decisions.

questions.question: Which kind of dependencies should be avoided when implementing secure design principles in software-defined networking (SDN)?
questions.explanation: Circular dependencies create infinite loops and unstable systems, violating secure design principles by introducing potential failure points and unpredictable behavior.

questions.question: Which mechanism provides the BEST protection against buffer overflow attacks in memory?
questions.explanation: ASLR randomizes memory addresses, making it extremely difficult for attackers to predict where to inject malicious code during buffer overflow exploits.

questions.question: Which of the following terms is used for online service providers operating within a federation?
questions.explanation: Relying Party (RP) is the term for service providers that rely on identity providers within a federation for user authentication.

questions.question: The Chief Information Security Officer (CISO) of a large financial institution is responsible for implementing the security controls to protect the confidentiality and integrity of the organization's Information Systems. Which of the controls below is prioritized FIRST?
options: Web application firewall (WAF) and HyperText Transfer Protocol Secure (HTTPS)
Encryption of data in transit and data at rest
questions.explanation: Encryption directly protects confidentiality and integrity of data both in transit and at rest, providing fundamental protection for financial data.

questions.question: Who is the BEST person to review developed application code to ensure it has been tested and verified?
options: A developer who knows what is expected of the application, but not the same one who developed it
A member of quality assurance (QA) should review the developer's code
A developer who understands the application requirements document, and who also developed the code
The manager should review the developer's application code
questions.explanation: Peer review by a different developer provides technical expertise while avoiding the original developer's blind spots and biases.

questions.question: A bank failed to meet service-level agreements (SLA) with customers after suffering from a database failure of the transaction processing system (TPS) that resulted in delayed financial deposits. A regulatory agency overseeing the bank would like to determine if the cause of the delay was a material weakness. Which of the following documents is MOST relevant for the regulatory agency to review?
questions.explanation: The BCP documents how the organization responds to disruptions and maintains operations, directly relevant to understanding why SLA failures occurred.

questions.question: What is the MOST effective way to ensure that a cloud service provider does not access a customer's data stored within its infrastructure?
options: Use the organization's encryption tools and data management controls
Ensure that the cloud service provider will contractually not access data unless given explicit authority
Request audit logs on a regular basis
Utilize the cloud provider's key management and elastic hardware security module (HSM) support
questions.explanation: Using customer-controlled encryption and key management ensures the cloud provider cannot decrypt data, providing technical enforcement beyond contractual agreements.

questions.question: Prohibiting which of the following techniques is MOST helpful in preventing users from obtaining confidential data by using statistical queries?
options: Sequences of queries that refer repeatedly to the same population
Repeated queries that access multiple databases
Selecting all records from a table and displaying all columns
Running queries that access sensitive data
questions.explanation: Repeated queries on the same population enable inference attacks where users can deduce individual values through statistical analysis, compromising confidentiality.

questions.question: Which of the following is a major component of the federated identity management (FIM) implementation model and used to establish a network between dozens of organizations?
questions.explanation: A Trusted Third Party serves as a central authority that organizations trust, enabling federation across multiple organizations without requiring bilateral trust relationships.

questions.question: A Chief Information Security Officer (CISO) is considering various proposals for evaluating security weaknesses and vulnerabilities at the source code level. Which of the following items BEST equips the CISO to make smart decisions for the organization?
options: The Common Weakness Risk Analysis Framework (CWRAF)
The Open Web Application Security Project (OWASP) Top Ten
questions.explanation: CWRAF provides a framework for analyzing and prioritizing security weaknesses at the source code level, enabling risk-based decision making.

questions.question: Which of the following methods is MOST effective in mitigating Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities within HyperText Markup Language (HTML) websites?
options: Use antivirus and endpoint protection on the server to secure the web-based application
Place the web-based system in a defined Demilitarized Zone (DMZ)
Use .NET framework with .aspx extension to provide a higher level of security to the web application so that the web server display can be locked down
Not returning any HTML tags to the browser client
questions.explanation: Preventing HTML tags from being returned to the browser (output encoding/escaping) directly prevents XSS by ensuring user input is treated as data, not executable code.

questions.question: Which of the following MOST accurately describes the Security Target (ST) in the Common Criteria framework?
options: The set of rules that define how resources or assets are managed and protected
A product independent set of security criteria for a class of products
The product and documentation to be evaluated
A document that includes a product specific set of security criteria
questions.explanation: The Security Target is a product-specific document that defines the security requirements and claims for a particular product being evaluated.

questions.question: An organization has approved deployment of a virtual environment for the development servers and has established controls for restricting access to resources. In order to implement best security practices for the virtual environment, the security team MUST also implement which of the following steps?
options: Implement a dedicated management network for the hypervisor
Deploy Terminal Access Controller Access Control System Plus (TACACS+) for authentication
Implement complex passwords using Privileged Access Management (PAM)
Capture network traffic for the network interface
questions.explanation: A dedicated management network isolates hypervisor management traffic from production networks, preventing unauthorized access and lateral movement.

questions.question: Which of the following is a weakness of the Data Encryption Standard (DES)?
options: Use of same key for encryption and decryption
questions.explanation: DES's 56-bit key length is too short by modern standards, making it vulnerable to brute-force attacks with current computing power.
